verses.text: And it came to pass in the \w ninth|strong="H8671"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*, in the \w tenth|strong="H6224"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, in the \w tenth|strong="H6218"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, \add that\add* \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w*, he, and all his \w host|strong="H2428"\w*, against \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and \w pitched|strong="H2583"\w* against it; and they \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w forts|strong="H1785"\w* against it round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*.
And the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* was \w besieged|strong="H0935"\w* unto the \w eleventh|strong="H6249"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w*.

And on the \w ninth|strong="H8672"\w* \add day\add* of the \add fourth\add* \w month|strong="H2320"\w* the \w famine|strong="H7458"\w* \w prevailed|strong="H2388"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and there was no \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* for the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*.

¶ And the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* was broken \w up|strong="H1234"\w*, and all the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w* \add fled\add* by \w night|strong="H3915"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* between two \w walls|strong="H2346"\w*, which \add is\add* by the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w garden|strong="H1588"\w*: (now the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w* \add were\add* against the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*:) and \add the king\add* \w went|strong="H3212"\w* the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* toward the \w plain|strong="H6160"\w*.

And the \w army|strong="H2428"\w* of the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w* \w pursued|strong="H7291"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w overtook|strong="H5381"\w* him in the \w plains|strong="H6160"\w* of \w Jericho|strong="H3405"\w*: and all his \w army|strong="H2428"\w* were \w scattered|strong="H6327"\w* from him.

So they \w took|strong="H8610"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and brought him \w up|strong="H5927"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* to \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w*; and they \w gave|strong="H1696"\w* \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w* upon him.\f + \fr 25.6 \ft gave…: Heb. spake judgment with him\f*

And they \w slew|strong="H7819"\w* the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w* before his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, and put \w out|strong="H5786"\w* the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of \w Zedekiah|strong="H6667"\w*, and \w bound|strong="H0631"\w* him with \w fetters|strong="H5178"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*, and \w carried|strong="H0935"\w* him to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.\f + \fr 25.7 \ft put…: Heb. made blind\f*

¶ And in the \w fifth|strong="H2549"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, on the \w seventh|strong="H7651"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, which \add is\add* the \w nineteenth|strong="H8672"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w*, \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w*, a \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, unto \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*:\f + \fr 25.8 \ft captain…: or, chief marshal\f*

And he \w burnt|strong="H8313"\w* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and all the \w houses|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and every \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \add man’s\add* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w burnt|strong="H8313"\w* he with \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*.

And all the \w army|strong="H2428"\w* of the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w*, that \add were with\add* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w*, brake \w down|strong="H5422"\w* the \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*.

Now the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \add that were\add* \w left|strong="H7604"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and the \w fugitives|strong="H5307"\w* that fell \w away|strong="H5307"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, with the \w remnant|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w multitude|strong="H1995"\w*, did \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w* the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* carry \w away|strong="H1540"\w*.\f + \fr 25.11 \ft fugitives: Heb. fallen away\f*

But the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w left|strong="H7604"\w* of the \w poor|strong="H1803"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* \add to be\add* \w vinedressers|strong="H3755"\w* and \w husbandmen|strong="H3009"\w*.

And the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* that \add were\add* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and the \w bases|strong="H4350"\w*, and the \w brasen|strong="H5178"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* that \add was\add* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, did the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w* break in \w pieces|strong="H7665"\w*, and \w carried|strong="H5375"\w* the \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* of them to \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*.

And the \w pots|strong="H5518"\w*, and the \w shovels|strong="H3257"\w*, and the \w snuffers|strong="H4212"\w*, and the \w spoons|strong="H3709"\w*, and all the \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* wherewith they \w ministered|strong="H8334"\w*, took they \w away|strong="H3947"\w*.

And the \w firepans|strong="H4289"\w*, and the \w bowls|strong="H4219"\w*, \add and\add* such things as \add were\add* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, \add in\add* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, and of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, \add in\add* \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* took \w away|strong="H3947"\w*.

The \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*, \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, and the \w bases|strong="H4350"\w* which \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* had \w made|strong="H6213"\w* for the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; the \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* of all these \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* was \w without|strong="H3808"\w* \w weight|strong="H4948"\w*.\f + \fr 25.16 \ft one…: Heb. the one sea\f*

The \w height|strong="H6967"\w* of the \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w pillar|strong="H5982"\w* \add was\add* \w eighteen|strong="H8083"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w*, and the \w chapiter|strong="H3805"\w* upon it \add was\add* \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*: and the \w height|strong="H6967"\w* of the \w chapiter|strong="H3805"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w*; and the wreathen \w work|strong="H7639"\w*, and \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* upon the \w chapiter|strong="H3805"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*, all of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*: and like unto these had the \w second|strong="H8145"\w* \w pillar|strong="H5982"\w* with wreathen \w work|strong="H7639"\w*.

¶ And the \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w Seraiah|strong="H8304"\w* the \w chief|strong="H7218"\w* \w priest|strong="H3548"\w*, and \w Zephaniah|strong="H6846"\w* the \w second|strong="H4932"\w* \w priest|strong="H3548"\w*, and the \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w keepers|strong="H8104"\w* of the \w door|strong="H5592"\w*:\f + \fr 25.18 \ft door: Heb. threshold\f*

And out of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* he \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w an|strong="H0259"\w* \w officer|strong="H5631"\w* that was \w set|strong="H6496"\w* over the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w*, and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of them that \w were|strong="H7200"\w* in the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w presence|strong="H6440"\w*, which were \w found|strong="H4672"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and the \w principal|strong="H8269"\w* \w scribe|strong="H5608"\w* of the \w host|strong="H6635"\w*, which \w mustered|strong="H6633"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, and \w threescore|strong="H8346"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* \add that were\add* \w found|strong="H4672"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*:\f + \fr 25.19 \ft officer: or, eunuch\f*\f + \fr 25.19 \ft were in…: Heb. saw the king’s face\f*\f + \fr 25.19 \ft principal…: or, scribe of the captain of the host\f*

And \w Nebuzar-adan|strong="H5018"\w* \w captain|strong="H7227"\w* of the \w guard|strong="H2876"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* these, and \w brought|strong="H3212"\w* them to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* to \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w*:

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* them, and \w slew|strong="H4191"\w* them at \w Riblah|strong="H7247"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Hamath|strong="H2574"\w*. So \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* was carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w* out of their \w land|strong="H0127"\w*.

¶ And \add as for\add* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \w remained|strong="H7604"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, whom \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* had \w left|strong="H7604"\w*, even over them he made \w Gedaliah|strong="H1436"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ahikam|strong="H0296"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shaphan|strong="H8227"\w*, \w ruler|strong="H6485"\w*.

And when all the \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w armies|strong="H2428"\w*, they and their \w men|strong="H0582"\w*, \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* had made \w Gedaliah|strong="H1436"\w* \w governor|strong="H6485"\w*, there \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Gedaliah|strong="H1436"\w* to \w Mizpah|strong="H4709"\w*, even \w Ishmael|strong="H3458"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nethaniah|strong="H5418"\w*, and \w Johanan|strong="H3110"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Careah|strong="H7143"\w*, and \w Seraiah|strong="H8304"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Tanhumeth|strong="H8576"\w* the \w Netophathite|strong="H5200"\w*, and \w Jaazaniah|strong="H2970"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of a \w Maachathite|strong="H4602"\w*, they and their \w men|strong="H0582"\w*.

And \w Gedaliah|strong="H1436"\w* \w sware|strong="H7650"\w* to them, and to their \w men|strong="H0582"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, \w Fear|strong="H3372"\w* not to be the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w*: \w dwell|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, and \w serve|strong="H5647"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*; and it shall be \w well|strong="H3190"\w* with you.

But it came to pass in the \w seventh|strong="H7637"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, that \w Ishmael|strong="H3458"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nethaniah|strong="H5418"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Elishama|strong="H0476"\w*, of the \w seed|strong="H2233"\w* \w royal|strong="H4410"\w*, \w came|strong="H0935"\w*, and \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* with him, and \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Gedaliah|strong="H1436"\w*, that he \w died|strong="H4191"\w*, and the \w Jews|strong="H3064"\w* and the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w* that were with him at \w Mizpah|strong="H4709"\w*.\f + \fr 25.25 \ft royal: Heb. of the kingdom\f*

And all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, both \w small|strong="H6996"\w* and \w great|strong="H1419"\w*, and the \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w armies|strong="H2428"\w*, \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*: for they were \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* \w of|strong="H6440"\w* the \w Chaldees|strong="H3778"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass in the \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* and \w thirtieth|strong="H7970"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of the \w captivity|strong="H1546"\w* of \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, in the \w twelfth|strong="H8147"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, on the \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* and \w twentieth|strong="H6242"\w* \add day\add* of the \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, \add that\add* \w Evil-merodach|strong="H0192"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* in the \w year|strong="H8141"\w* that he began to \w reign|strong="H4427"\w* did lift \w up|strong="H5375"\w* the \w head|strong="H7218"\w* of \w Jehoiachin|strong="H3078"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* out of \w prison|strong="H1004"\w*;

And he \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* \w kindly|strong="H2896"\w* to him, and \w set|strong="H5414"\w* his \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* above the \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* of the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* that \add were\add* with him in \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*;\f + \fr 25.28 \ft kindly…: Heb. good things with him\f*

And \w changed|strong="H8132"\w* his \w prison|strong="H3608"\w* \w garments|strong="H0899"\w*: and he did \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* \w continually|strong="H8548"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.

And his \w allowance|strong="H0737"\w* \add was\add* a \w continual|strong="H8548"\w* \w allowance|strong="H0737"\w* \w given|strong="H5414"\w* him of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, a \w daily|strong="H3117"\w* \w rate|strong="H1697"\w* for every \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.
